website_summaries.verdict: A low-cost laser line with a single beam. This basic tool is designed for simple projects.
cons: No clamp or way to attach a stand

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: It’s a pretty useful and handy tool because it’s all in one, but I bought this tool mostly for its laser function, which I would like to use it as a guideline for writing and drawing, but the line doesn’t have the right angle even I adjusted it as the manual said (see pictures). Also attached some other pictures of this product just for your references. After leaving the comments above, the 3rd party seller contacted me and sent me a new adjusted one for free, which is really good costumer service, so I added 2 stars for them.
customer_reviews.author: R.C.

customer_reviews.title: Not very level.
customer_reviews.text: I did some manual tests and after comparing it to a string, the laser is not aligned with the bubble level and thus not accurate. Waste of money for me. Update: I was provided with a refund for this product. I was then requested to either delete the review or change it to 4 stars by Rose from Qooltek Services (they contacted me through a generic gmail account). Attached is a picture of the issue I was experiencing with my laser level. Attempting to adjust the laser seated in the plastic case doesn't fix the inaccuracy. Regardless, I wouldn't recommend this product. The customer service also seems to only care about review scores.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Mason

customer_reviews.title: Terrible piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Terrible piece of junk. The laser is way off. We hung two pictures and we're both off by almost an inch. We could eyeball it better than that. And the cheap tape measure that comes out of the side snaps back in so quickly it will slice your hand open if it's in the way
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Wish they made all my tools.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived today and when i opened it i was blown away. Comes with a screw driver bc the battery cover. I go to put in Tyne batteries only to see a little white pull tab... it came w an extra set 😁 and an additional adjustment bar. I managed to use tape to secure the extra bits to my laser level.
customer_reviews.author: Kammanaka

customer_reviews.title: Miserable Instructions but very good to use once adjusted.
customer_reviews.text: Here's how to adjust: Set the unit down on a table with the Amazon box about a foot away. Since Both the laser level and the box are on the same plane, you are assured that you are measuring properly. Move the laser window to its middle position - it will now generate a crosshair. Turn on the laser and aim it at the Amazon box's barcode -- CAREFULLY rotate the laser window a bit if the crosshair is not perfect. Now you can hang pictures with arrived leveling and balancing.
customer_reviews.author: Red Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Buy a reputalbe brand, not this one.
customer_reviews.text: The laser was not accurate out of the box. Adjusting the laser is simple, but to get it accurate is impossible. Level bubbles are off also. I should have just spent the money and bought a more reputable brand from the get go.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua A Craig

customer_reviews.title: Well built, all functions work great!
customer_reviews.text: As a 3D printing business we find a need for all sorts of tools. In looking for a metric tape measure I came across this multipurpose tool and I'm so glad I settled on this! Not only do all the functions work great but it also came with a small standalone metal ruler in addition to the attached rulers and tape measure. The laser is bright and came perfectly level, and the tape lock works well. If you're considering this item and aren't super hard on your tools (this is primarily constructed of strong plastic) then you'll find this multipurpose tool extremely useful.
customer_reviews.author: Joe, Access3Dservices

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: WOW!! I just received this and taking it out of the package I was impressed. It is a very sturdy product and packaged with extra batteries and a screwdriver to change the batteries with. For a company to put this much thought into their packaging I am sure this will be a wonderful product to use. I have turned it on and shown pictures here of the laser in a bright room from 32 inches. The laser line from 32 inches is plenty bright enough and measures about the same distance up and down and across that the laser is from the wall (32 inches). For this price, you cant go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: DPJ

customer_reviews.title: Laser is not straight, don't purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the laser. I read another review where it was demonstrated the laser was not straight so I made the purchase with a lot of reservation. Immediately I tested the straightness of the laser. Mine as well is not accurate. I don't know what is it about the product that some lasers are straight and some are not. The product needs to be tested for working condition before selling. Would not recommend as literally the one thing this product should be able to do would be to send a laser beam in a straight direction. If it worked, it appears it is very easy to use. Will be throwing away.
customer_reviews.author: LIna Ortega

customer_reviews.title: More than just a laser level.
customer_reviews.text: This was definitely a surprise when I received it. I was expecting just a basic laser level with no extras. I am certainly "Happy" with this purchase. Along with the laser level you're given a little screw driver and extra batteries to go with the laser level. Idk if I'll need to buy more. On top of that you're given a little ruler. This thing is pretty accurate as well. We have been able to put up our art wall with relative ease thanks to this!
customer_reviews.author: Elias

customer_reviews.title: This is a toy not a tool.  Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: The levels do not work. Compare to a real level and it is not close to the same. Without accurate levels it is a toy for playing with the cat. In addition the levels are not oriented to provide needed information. The laser line is vertical so you need a horizontal level to check the line. The shape of the level is not square so you can’t get a horizontal line by placing the laser on its side. The laser works well so it is a shame the levels are not close to accurate and oriented correctly. This is a flawed design.
customer_reviews.author: Ken325

customer_reviews.title: Item Isn’t Level Itself - Does Not Produce a Level Line
customer_reviews.text: The product doesn’t sit flat by itself which renders the product completely unusable. This item should also have a way to mount so you don’t have to stack uneven books and use folded post it’s to level it out.
customer_reviews.author: topherBradley

customer_reviews.title: lots of bells and whistles, but then the basic needs go forgotten... liquid balance is not at same level as flat ruler side FAIL
customer_reviews.text: great idea for this product, and great in all respects in theory - however the liquid balances are not levelled up with the flat ruler side of this tool, so its essentially useless for a great deal of the projects I had in mind to use it for, without needing to go out and buy a whole other smaller level which is actually level ( which I ended up doing anyways and getting for a dollar from harbor freight. even at $1, they figured out how to get the basic measurements of their tool done properly.)
customer_reviews.author: Erica B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent multitool in a small package
customer_reviews.text: Great multitool for the price! The level and laser guides work great! The measuring tape is accurate and the retraction is really powerful! For the price this a great product. Multitools usually have to compromise a few things to fit so much functionality into one package. In this case I think the measuring tape suffers more than the other functions. As you extend it further it does become more difficult to keep the tape straight if you're tape measure hanging midair. But you're still getting a solid multitool for a great price so I can't be to critical on it! I definitely recommend if you need something for a lot of small indoor projects.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Laser Level is excellent, arrived accurately calibrated.
customer_reviews.text: No dislikes at all. The instrument is accurately calibrated. A few reviewers said there were no instructions but I did receive them -- thankfully, as they explained how to change the laser patterns by simply flipping three positions with your finger on a tab near the lens. Trying to turn the lens with a screwdriver is NOT the way to change the laser patterns. I used it to determine/monitor a proper water drain slope/degree when I repaired my patio floor and replacing the gutter. If I had a weak laser projection on a rough/dark surface, I simply taped a piece of white copy paper on the inspection area to increase laser reflection/brightness. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but it comes in handy.
customer_reviews.text: This tool comes in handy. I have yet to use the laser level feature but it’s quite easy shifting the markers to go horizontal, vertical or as a “+”. The measuring tape could be a little thicker. It’s a bit flimsy but works. One thing I would like to see in a newer model is to actually have the mini screw driver as part of the unit instead of as a separate piece. Th other side of the laser mounting could be a flashlight. Otherwise this gadget comes in handy and is fairly lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: RJM

customer_reviews.title: Makes an excellent first impression
customer_reviews.text: The device is packaged well and includes useful, cogent instructions from someone fluent in English. It comes with batteries already installed. Although you might not need them for a number of years, the package even includes a set of extra batteries—and a diminutive screwdriver for accessing the battery compartment! I’ve used it several times. I’m no authority, but it seems to perform well.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good service useful item
customer_reviews.text: Edit: upon receiving my review, the seller contacted me and sent a replacement level, which CAN be calibrated properly. Given that I now have a working version, it's a good value for money and is a convenient tool for hanging posters/pictures or keeping in a toolbox to replace a full size level when traveling. I gave it a 4/5, but if you get a working version on the first attempt, it's a pretty solid 5/5. Original Review: Laser came uncalibrated and device could be hand calibrated as claimed. Significant force was applied to attempt to turn the lens, with no effect.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: It's just a level
customer_reviews.text: While it's true this is a level that has a laser on it, the fact that there are no self-leveling or hands-free leveling capabilities makes the laser impossible to use in a practical way. I havent seen a video demonstrating practical use of it on this device. Between that and the fact that this level is so short, even tasks like lining up holes across studs (16" apart) aren't possible. It's a fine little level for small things, but I think you can just buy a cheaper level that skips the laser gimmick.
customer_reviews.author: Tom L

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This was a disappointment. It's nice to have a multi-tool like this, but somehow, the laser has become offset and I can't figure out how to fix it. I've only had it for 3 months now. Good level, but without the laser, it wasn't worth $13. Update: The company sent me a new one, and this one feels a bit better in the hand. Hoping it lasts for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley K. Siefert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service - Original Laser Level Replaced w/No Charge - Problem Solved!
customer_reviews.text: The original laser level was slightly off when the bubble was centered in the horizontal position - effectively making the laser worthless the longer the distance from the device. The company contacted me directly - and replaced the level at no cost - works great. I am very pleased and appreciate the outreach.
customer_reviews.author: Eric A. Nicolaus

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It just makes a laser line. There is no way to know if its level. When I put something under to make the bubble level, it makes the line totally crooked.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: A nice little multi-use tool! Love the extra ruler.
customer_reviews.text: I got this on a lightning deal and I am very pleased with it. A little better quality than expected. I haven't analyzed its precision, but it seems to be good. I love having the measuring tape, 3-levels, the fixed measuring ruler, and laser levels all in one small unit. It even came with an extra metal ruler - it's short, but actually something I really needed - tired of using tape measure for measuring small distances - the ruler is very easy to read and includes both metric and imperial. Very good!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff & Wendy S

customer_reviews.title: More than you'd expect
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this, I love how it gives me 3 different modes to align my pictures! As a bonus, there is a small screwdriver and ruler that comes with it. I wasn't expecting those! I like how there is a built-in tape measurer. This is a must have for any homeowners' toolbox!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara E Emerson

customer_reviews.title: For the price, unbeatable,
customer_reviews.text: While I doubt this would meet the needs of a professional carpenter or handyman, this tool is a fine addition to the family toolbox. If feels well made, is solid, and has a look of quality that leaves me with the feeling it will last the rest of my years provided I don't bang it around too much. Lastly, for the price, this thing is packed with potential solutions and comes with 3 spare watch cell batteries, and a small metal ruler used to align the laser head. If you do small projects around the home from time to time, don't think about this - just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: A neat little tool (excellent for the price)
customer_reviews.text: A neat little tool (excellent for the price). Not something I will use a lot, but I was installing some drain pipe and needed an inexpensive way to check slope. True the laser couldn't be seen at distance in bright sun, but I just waited till dusk and then was able to check the slope of my pipe at nearly 40 ft away.
customer_reviews.author: RussTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable level
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance on this instead of a nice $40-50 laser level. The level is unreliable. You can actually flip it around and get different results somehow. Also, either every wall in our house is slanted or the laser is faulty or at least weak. Just use a standard level you have lying around or pay up for a good laser level. The built-in tape measure would be a nice touch if the rest of it actually worked.
customer_reviews.author: mjk280

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This was absolute crap. The first time we tried to use it, the line we marked out was crooked. When we tried to use it again the next day, the air bubble inside had split. Don't waste your money. Update: The company reached out and was kind enough to offer us a new level. We have not yet had a chance to use it, but I appreciated their willingness to try to make up for the first product we received.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Handy to have.
customer_reviews.text: Nice features. Level is handy as a torpedo level, but serves for making the laser level too. Great that it has three beam orientations, horizontal, vertical, and crosshairs. Easily switchable. Only drawback is that its not powerful enough to use outside hardly at all. Beam has good distance indoors. I have several other more expensive lasers for other specific uses, but this is good for quick beams. Turns out to be too wimpy for carpenters. Ok if you only need 3-4ft beam. Gave it to my grandson to play cus he likes the tape measure.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Fixit

customer_reviews.title: The perfect stocking stuffer
customer_reviews.text: For once my husband liked what I purchased for him. Its a miracle! A plumber by trade, I purchased this for home renovation, hoping to avoid going thru twenty toolboxes and this little item was beyond expectation. It fits neatly in one hand without weighing you down. A must stocking stuffer for the guy who has everything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as you'd need!
customer_reviews.text: I really needed/wanted a laser sight/level. This product fulfills that in all regards, and then some. Very versatile unit in a compact package. Has many useful features, integrated tape measure and 3 spirit levels, along with the laser operations. Laser provides horizontal, vertical, and cross hair lines. Can't think of anything more I could want in a very handy tool. If this is something you're looking for, this is the one I recommend. And yes, I'd buy it again and give it as a gift to family and friends!
customer_reviews.author: G. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Crooked
customer_reviews.text: The level works, because it's hard to mess with physics. The bubble will always sit in the middle on level. The laser on the other hand is badly misaligned, as other have noted. It is not reliable in conjunction with he level. Which sucks, cause that's the idea... Tape measure works well enough, accuracy of any mass produced measurements device is dubious. Good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Juke-Redlin

customer_reviews.title: Lots of features. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have to figure out how to use it better. I haven't found out how it can help me layout and level my walls. The cross can be rotated. I accidentally did that. It has some nice features. I think once I understand the technique of using it. It will be a great value to me. I'm building a faux wall one 2"x4" at a time and couldn't figure out how to ensure the top plate was straight. Then tried to ensure wall was in the same plane.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hollins

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I may just be doing something wrong. The laser line emitted by this is not level, defeating the entire point. I held the laser level up to a wall on one side of a window, and used the included bubble level to make sure it was level. Then I turned on the laser, and it was pointing at an angle. It was way off by the time it reached the other side of the window. I tried using a screwdriver to twist the ring around the emitter, but that just seemed to make things worse. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mabe

customer_reviews.title: I gots a a new toy!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry about the headline, but I really do feel like a kid in a sweet shop with this multipurpose laser. I am about to embark on fitting slat walls to my utility room in the basement and I needed something a little more accurate than a standard level - this provided me that and more! The casing is a little chintzy to be honest - what my Dad would call cheaply made, but the actually components are top-notch with the added bonus of a built in tape measure for those shorter runs - I am excited to put it all into operation!
customer_reviews.author: A PC Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Not useful in hanging a single frame and making it level
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me in leveling when I hang frames on the wall. I thought the laser beam will do the trick but unfortunately, it was hard to figure out. When I hang a frame on the wall, I hoped that the laser can be used to determine where I will put the nails on both sides of the frame so the frame will be level. I think the laser will be useful only when leveling several frames but not in hanging a single frame. Can I return this?
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little multi tool for measuring and leveling. If they would have added a magnetic base and horizontal level it would be perfect. The size is great, compact, can be stored in a drawer, glove compartment, tool box. The tape automatically locks when pulled out. Button retracts it. Nice to have the 6" scale as well. Multi levels make it very useful, but the addition of a horizontal level would make the laser cross hair more useful. Great device.
customer_reviews.author: F5CobraGuy

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with beam not level, and beam not very bright. Price reflects quality, might have its uses.
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect perfection for this price tag, however, the laser projection itself arrived skew, I had to carefully twist the projector to be as close to level as possible, But I have no guarantee that I got it right. If the leveling function of a leveler can go out of level, I struggle to call it a “level”. Also the laser beam is quite weak, don't expect to be able to use it in a bright room or outdoors. It’s best purpose would be in a dim room at a range of <10ft.
customer_reviews.author: Charl

customer_reviews.title: worth ever nickel
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and to be fair it's a pretty useful tool,, of course me being a bit of a Geek (Metrologist) I had to see if the laser was calibrated , I compared it to a Bosch self leveling Laser and it was off.. but the best part is that unlike other more expensive items " it is adjustable " that made all the difference .. the tape measure I can do without as I have too many of those around the shop already but hey .. it's inexpensive , looks pretty durable , "adjustable" laser and won't weigh down the nail apron .. nice tool !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vernon E.

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: More than i expected. It came with a little screwdriver for the battery door AND extra batteries! There's also a 6" steel scale (ruler) in the box. It's used for adjusting the laser. They could have put a 2 inch piece of blank metal in the box for that function but added another measuring device instead. It was thoughtful, I like that! Setup is easy adjusting is easy and it pretty solid. I gave it a 4 because the laser just isn't quite enough to use in daylight and be seen easily. Overall, it's a great, cost effective laser level!
customer_reviews.author: BoonDock Saint

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Measuring tape doesn't stay in place and the laser is only verticle no matter how you place it. Should have horizontal laser as well as that's needed more often than not.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: Good level with measuring tape
customer_reviews.text: This laser level has a tape measure (about 8 ft) and is very useful. The laser has vertical, horizontal and cross hair. Also, it has the usual level bubbles -horizontal, vertical and 45 degrees. But I was pleasantly surprised to see they enclosed three extra LR44 batteries, a 6" metal ruler and a screw driver to open the battery compartment. None of this extras were mentioned in the description. Great job guys.
customer_reviews.author: Narahari Mahadevan

customer_reviews.title: It's useful for minor things
customer_reviews.text: Pros: level is adjustable to keep it true. Laser is reasonably accurate . Convenient. Good size. Eady to read. Good price. Cons: Laser does not auto turn off causing battery to drain fast. Tape measure is hard to pull out. Would I buy it again? No I'd probably just buy a plain level unless I needed the laser. PS - take the batteries out before throwing it in your tool drawer. The corrode and ruin the tool quicker than you think.
customer_reviews.author: The Rabbit Whisperer

customer_reviews.title: Well-built with some design flaws
customer_reviews.text: It works well with some annoying deficiency. 1) The laser switch located on the side keeps turning on accidentally if carrying it in the pocket. 2) The ruler retraction speed is too fast, can cause serious injury if the tape is not held to steady its retraction. 3) The top side of the ruler should be square rather than round tapered off, which prevents one from using it to accurate form a straight laser line from 1 end to the other end.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: Great laser level and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Initially I could not get the laser to turn on, even after installing fresh batteries. After discussing this problem with the seller, they shipped me a second unit, which I received in a few days. The second one works great. This is an incredible value. It includes horizontal and vertical laser guides, 3 different bubble levels, a built-in 8-foot tape measure, and two scales (one on the device plus a separate scale). This is an amazing value for such a low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wigell

customer_reviews.title: Two different readings
customer_reviews.text: Mounted a TV wall mount yesterday. Looked off but the leveler keep reading it as leveled. Later I found out that depending on which side you have it, it gives you different readings. Now I have to drill another set of 4 holes into my living room wall. Do not buy this. I also tested it on different surfaces and it keep giving me the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exploding batteries
customer_reviews.text: The original batteries in this unit came already exploded, since it cane with back ups we didn’t think much of it. We’ve had this unit for about a year and a half and used it once, today when we using it again it wouldn’t work and the batteries were yet again exploded, this time ruining the entire unit. Levels seem to work fine but the tape measure is very hard to pull out. I wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I literally have never used this thing, as the light is too dim and the fact it doesn't self-level does me no good. I cannot even think of a situation where the laser would be used. Edit: On 2/9/20 the seller tried to solicit me with a refund to remove this feedback and outside of Amazon Messaging system. This is against Seller Code of Conduct and reported.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: I adjusted it as much as I could without feeling like I was gonna break something using the thin metal ...
customer_reviews.text: Not even CLOSE to accurate when it arrived. I adjusted it as much as I could without feeling like I was gonna break something using the thin metal ruler they call an "adjusting tool". I got it close but it's still not perfect. It might be good enough for putting up drywall. We'll see. Update: Qooltek sent me another almost immediately after reading my original review. They contacted me several times to be sure I was satisfied. I honestly can't believe their customer support. They even sent me a Christmas wish! The new one is perfect. Dead accurate right out of the box. I'm really amazed at the support for a $12 item.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M

customer_reviews.title: Good value but beware of design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I really like this laser tape measure, it works and came with extra batteries but it has a design flaw that is dangerous. I was measuring something against the wall using the tape measure and holding with my right hand. My palm accidentally depressed the auto retacct button and it very quickly retracted the tape all the way back and took a chunk out of my finger. If this design flaw didn’t exist I’d give 5 stars but having it snap back metal against metal is a definite hazard when using.
customer_reviews.author: Winter Park, CO

customer_reviews.title: accuracy problems with the level of the laser
customer_reviews.text: I had accuracy problems with the level of the laser. I bought this to do a list of projects around the house. I got about 2 projects in when I realized the laser was not projecting correctly (ever so slightly off). At first, I thought I had simply made a mistake when my level(s) were off, but after a few issues I come to find the laser is not accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Peters

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't level for me.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me - laser line wasn't level. Go figure... :( Purchased two and both were out of wack. Came in a box but with no instructions. The price was inexpensive but the product was very cheap, so I guess you get what you pay for. It did have a built in tape measure, which is a nice feature but since the level didn't work, it was useless to me. I sent it back with no problems and I appreciate Amazon's customer service with this item.
customer_reviews.author: ABarbs13

customer_reviews.title: Fair
customer_reviews.text: This is a good deal for the price but not really worth it. The laser came off center and is very hard to calibrate. There is no top level which makes it hard to use for some projects. The levels themselves work but could be more accurate with the lines. The tape measure functions and has a good locking mechanism. Over all its decent for the money but you are better off spending a bit more even for home DIY use.
customer_reviews.author: b.alec

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I don’t write many product reviews - typically only when I’m either very very pleased or very very dissatisfied with a purchase. In this case, I’m extremely impressed. This device is even more than what what it promises to be. For example, I didn’t expect it to come with batteries. It not only came with batteries installed, it also came with an extra set. Anyway, it is so convenient to have so much functionality in a single, small tool. Each component works perfectly. Even at twice the price, it’s a tremendous value.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but they gave it a good shot!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little disappointed after how great the reviews seemed to think this was. The laser is nowhere near dialed in. From what I could tell, you can adjust the rotation of the lines (+/x) but they weren't straight to begin with. I have yet to figure out how to adjust that part. Without that, the leveling bubbles are worthless. I would also skip the tape measure to save weight. I tried to stick it on the wall with double-sided tape and the tape would not hold. I would recommend you spend a little more to get something higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: I like the product
customer_reviews.text: I like the product. It's really cool and comes with extra batteries which helps just In case. Everything works good. But when I went to measure some stuff for my new apartment. The button to retract the tape measure broke and now I can't even use it. And the thing snapped so I have nothing to fix it and I tried to use a knife to fix it and pop off the button to put it in place but still doesn't work. Good product but kinda sucks that after 1 use. It already broke. And I took the tape measure out to 19ins. And the button broke. So I'm kinda sad about that
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Q.

customer_reviews.title: works for smaller areas
customer_reviews.text: Lights up vertically and/or horizontally across the room, but the farther out, the less accurate, especially if it needs to be sitting on a level surface to begin with. Probably has some uses. Bright red light, doesn't seem dangerous, but don't look directly into it - as per directions.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Works well as advertised - the red 'on' button little too large - I've turned it on by mistake by having it inside my tool belt
customer_reviews.text: Works well - as advertised - the red 'on' button little too large - I've turned it on by mistake by having it inside my tool belt - tools rub against the button and turn it on...then batteries die if you don't notice it turned itself on. Other than that it works fine and is a good item for smaller jobs. It would be better if the 'ON" button was flush with the frame of the piece where other things in your tool belt/pocket don't turn it on accidentally.
customer_reviews.author: Eurotall

customer_reviews.title: Terrible accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Used it to hang a mirror. Got done and realized after that it was crooked. Took my very large level out and checked my line - it was 5 degrees off. Had to remove the mirror, drill a new hole on the other side which means I have a hole to fix. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Peanut1964

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tool
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED REVIEW - The design was fixed and improved in the newest version. It completely solved the issue of scrapping the wall plus added additional functionality that was unexpected and very helpful! Also the core product was improved. Overall, it is a big step up from the original product I purchased. The new leveling laser (the laser itself) is much improved as well. It is easier to adjust and MUCH stronger.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: came with dead batteries
customer_reviews.text: I bought as gift so it appears that the product works as described, however, the set of batteries that were in it were dead, even after I pulled the white tab from the battery compartment. I had to use the second set of batteries that come with the item to see it work. I had to buy another second set of batteries, really not worth the price then.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good but missing things needed for better functionality
customer_reviews.text: * After submitting my review i was contacted by the company stating they had prototype they could send me that would satisfy my needs. Recieved it a week later. It is magnetic but laser lines still do not project at the surface level. It's an improvement though for sure. Also would like to add that the laser switch should be redesigned. It is almost always turning itself on inside my tool bag. Batteries don't seem to like that. First review: Wish it was magnetic and laser lined up flush with surface.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Handy Level and Laser is great for picture grouping
customer_reviews.text: My first review is below and I will say that the seller contacted me and sent me a new level and the replacement has done great since - I do appreciate them making it right...you don't see that too often these days...will definitely purchase from them again...I just got a bad egg - it happens and now I have one that works great! This thing worked once and that was it....so now it's just a level....which I already have...was super excited to have a laser level but I'll keep shopping...
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my first home so I wasn’t entirely sure what I needed. I started to purchase tools that I figured would be the standard. I saw loads of ideas that I wanted to try. I wanted to make sure everything was installed properly since it is my own home and not a rented property. The tool is high quality and durable. The laser has been super handy with hanging wall decor. It has been useful with my new home remodel!
customer_reviews.author: Malaura Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and the laser is so helpful.
customer_reviews.text: Finally got a laser level to move away from stringing a stupid string and trying to hold an old fashioned bubble level to get it straight - or measuring from the edge to get the wall hangers set up properly. I used it to hang a large poster \ frame and it was so easy to get everything lined up.... The unit is very easy to use and is large enough to be easily handled and held but small enough to store easily in a small are. I shoudl have gotten one of these long ago.
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Indoor use
customer_reviews.text: Note well the in the description that this laser level is for indoor use only. Outdoors the laser is not visible. WORKS FOR INDOOR - designed for any situation where a straight line or accurate measurements are needed, such as measuring locations on a wall, space between hangers, level the nails. Regardless of the situation, it's completely plug & play. Note: Fades in sunlight or outdoor use. *** The company saw original my review and offered me a 50% refund because I was not totally satisfied. The fault was entirely mine since the product description clearly says it is for indoor use only. I'd saw that is outstanding customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Man

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: They have updated the laser and it is amazing. Previous reviews showed the laser was faint and the horizonatal line was hard to see. The one I received is extremely bright and accurate. I used it during the day in my house and the laser was extremely accurate (I measured it with a second level) and very bright, even at over 15 feet. 100% recommend this product for the price and accuracy of the level and laser.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Went the extra mile everywhere but the laser
customer_reviews.text: At first I was very impressed that they not only had batteries in the level, but provided an extra set AND provided a mini screwdriver so you can remove the battery compartment when you need. The laser is non adjustable and I only used it twice. Laser stopped working after that (bought a month ago). I had an “aha” moment remembering they provided an extra set of batteries. Only to find the laser still doesn’t work! I’ll now just use it as a spare tape measure and get an actual laser level
customer_reviews.author: ccbcatz

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item with very high hopes. I inoperable the box, use the tap measure function and the metal piece breaks completely off. It then retracted back into the device and is no unusable. The laser light itself should be in a fix position and it’s difficult to relabel it. The instructions are poorly written and does not cover set up. Avoid this item if possible
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C Rocko III

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I saw a good bit of bad reviews but I honestly love this product. It’s very bright a reaches far away. It also bends at corners. Lots of people had problems with tape measure but I found it works fine. It may be delicate but I’ve had no problems as long as you press the button to retract it because when you pull it out it stays in place while measuring.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: This laser level is perfect....almost
customer_reviews.text: I really love this laser level, perfect for hanging pictures and what a great price. Works better than the $100 one I was borrowing from a friend..at least for pictures. I lined up and put my comics on the wall in about 10 minutes. My only gripe is that the tape measure doesn't work very well, it doesn't stay locked in place and is very flimsy, it was bent as soon as i pulled it out once. Overall great buy, I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: HaV0K8Z3rO

customer_reviews.title: Useless tool. Buy a real laser if you need to shoot a straight line.
customer_reviews.text: You might use the level function. The laser function is useless. Very weak laser. No magnet to hold the level in place. I thought I could use it some to shoot straight lines across gate openings from post to post instead of a string level. Most useless tool in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I hardly ever write reviews, even when I get emails from companies requesting me to do so. However, I am so pleased with this Laser Level Pro3 that I have to write about how awesome it is! It came with batteries in it and extra batteries for when they die, (a screwdriver to unscrew the battery compartment to install the batteries),2 way level bubbles, a ruler that has both standard and metric measurements, 8 ft of measurement tape and the laser for hanging things is amazing!! And ... it was very inexpensive!! I can’t sing enough praises about this product!!
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Very useful multitool
customer_reviews.text: Hanging things on walls. Just this, a hammer and a nail. This was sent to me free, and my money refunded on a previously reviewed level, which I found had a weak magnet and would not stay vertical on metal items. The level was ideal for use on all materials except metal. This defect I thought somewhat limited its use. Now, if this tool was magnetic...😁👍
customer_reviews.author: Oceaneer

customer_reviews.title: Okay Unit
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to this unit. However, it turned out to be pretty cheap. The unit I received was either used/returned, or poorly manufactured. It had scratches and the metal-like label "band" was coming off. The worst part is the laser was not level at all, which makes it totally useless. Very disappointed. [UPDATE] The Seller offered to send me a new unit. The new unit was in better shape and worked better. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Hon. Scott H. McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Would purchase again!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! It is a level, laser level (with a cross section), and tape measurer. Also comes with a ruler, little screwdriver for battery changes and extra batteries!! My only bad thing is that it is a little small, so the level is pretty sensitive, but works great!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good Laser Level
customer_reviews.text: This was a good investment. I bought it for around the house projects and it works fine. It has 3 separate levels built into it, which helps depending on the project you are working on. The built in tape measurer comes in handy too. Make sure to avoid any eye contact with the laser itself so it doesn't damage your eyes. There is a red "on/off" switch for the laser on the side. I always keep it in the "off" position unless I am working. The laser has a decent range and can wrap around room corners at a 90 degree angle.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Not even
customer_reviews.text: After leveling, if the level rotated 180 degrees, the bubble is not the same distance from the stripes (not level anymore). It means that your measurements will jump depending which side you are going to place it. An easy test that this level doesn't pass.
customer_reviews.author: Vasiliy Kerov

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for hanging pictures.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the purchase of this level. It's compact and easy to use, they ship it with extra batteries and the screwdriver that you need when it's time to replace them. The only drawback that I can see is that it doesn't come with a pouch or case to keep everything together in my toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: MrsMorrow08

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I had one that was similar to this, but it fell apart after a lot of use. This unit is better constructed. I keep it in my man-cave to adjust my stereo speakers to the sweet spot, and the tape measure comes in handy very often. Good value for the money for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: badebop

customer_reviews.title: For small projects
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but you have to know what you’re doing. Not a bad product for the price. Personally I’d prefer the self leveling level. If you don’t know what you’re doing and you measure off something that isn’t level to begin with your laser line will be off. Need to know what you’re doing, good item for small projects. For big projects I would go with a more heavy duty self leveling laser.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Cool device, but inaccurate, and that's a deal killer for laser level
customer_reviews.text: This device would be an easy 5 stars if only it was actually level. In a couple of wall hanging projects in which multiple frames have to line up precisely, I've found it to be inaccurate to the point of being able to see with the naked eye. But I went ahead and verified the amount of variance with no less than 3 different spirit levels. On a horizontal line, it had a variance of nearly 2 inches in just span of 7 feet. That's just inexcusable for anything marketed as a level, much less with the precision of laser. Just can't recommend this item if it can't do the job.
customer_reviews.author: mackaz

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Very gimmicky. The base of the level is loose and I don't think it is very accurate. The tape measure on a level is a nice idea. The power button on the level for the laser is 100% exposed. If you put it in your tool bag, the batteries will be dead by the time you need to use it. If the manufacturer redesigned this it could be a really amazing tool that I would be willing to spend some money on if built out of the right material and had a guard for the laser on/off button.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Potenberg

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, yes but serves its purpose. Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Yes it is cheaply made but it does serve its function. It probably won't last forever but it will last long enough to get more than your $14.00 worth. Then you spring for another $14. But it works fine. Includes a tape measure for what its worth that works well. It actually comes out with drag and has a quick release button. I like that. As far as precision, both horizontal and vertical were perfectly level. I myself don't deal in microns. Not for the pro but handy to have around the house. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Before I even tried any of the other functions I made sure the level bubbles were accurate and they weren’t. It was off by a few millimeters so I just packed it back up and I’m returning it. I didn’t test any of the other functions because I didn’t feel there was a need. You definitely get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart/Updated March 12th, 2020
customer_reviews.text: First time I used it, the tape broke. (Updated review) However, the company contacted me and sent a new one out immediately. Upon opening it, I tested the tape which worked (several times) fine. The level works well and is very durable. The unit came with batteries installed as well as extra batteries for the laser. One of the things I like is a rail on the bottom of the level that allows the level to be secured in place and keep your hands free to go to the other end of the piece of work.
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: levels work, laser of minimal value
customer_reviews.text: The levels work well, but the laser has minimal value because you can't attach the device to anything. You also have to be careful to ensure that you don't turn on the laser when it is in a tool box or mixed with other items. There is nothing to protect the switch from being unintentionally being turned on.
customer_reviews.author: G. Norman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: This laser level arrived with batteries installed (and a pull tab to activate them) It also included a second set of batteries, a small screwdriver to open the battery compartment, and a small 6" ruler with metric on one side and inches on the other side with divisions in both 1/64ths and 1/50ths. This was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Moser

customer_reviews.title: A few problems
customer_reviews.text: I do like a lot of the features on this unit BUT... It's a bit to easy to knock the laser out of alignment while just changing the the display from horizontal to vertical to cross. It would be nice if the unit would actually accept the standard photographic 1/4" stud mount for a photographic tripod the short tripods that can be obtained for the unit have very limited application. It would be REAL helpful if a tripod adapter was available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got a defective one but seller made good
customer_reviews.text: Sellers customer service was good. They sent me a new one and tested it and as far as I can tell it is accurate. It has all the features and I want and a reasonable priced so as long as you get a good 1 I think it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: R1chardm

customer_reviews.title: Nice! Does what I need and does it well!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this laser level. I have an older laser level that was frustrating to use due to the laser lens being too loose and not staying in place. This lens is nice and tight in all three positions. With the metal base it sits well on surfaces, nice and evenly. The built in measuring tape is a great bonus. Definitely happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels like decent china quality. Lol. Not a fan of the batteries it takes but it does come with an extra set of batteries. Measuring tape will probably break after extended use. Laser is very bright and accurate when level. 4 stars because its not expensive and has an all in one swiss army feel for a level.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy manufacturing = completely useless product
customer_reviews.text: The bubble level isn't actually level, which completely defeats the purpose of this product. The manufacturing is so, so, so clearly subpar - it doesn't just render the level useless, it may actually hurt since you would be using a crooked laser projection. I reported this issue with the seller, who sent me a second unit. BOTH had the same exact issue with the plastic mold around the bubble level, meaning that at least a huge batch of units were affected. Don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Kimura

customer_reviews.title: A poorly designed tool
customer_reviews.text: OK as a spirit level only. Useless as anything else. The tape measure is ok but flimsy. The laser features are utterly useless if you, say, want to mount a picture on a wall, since there is no way to mount the level on a tripod. The best feature of this level is that (a) your losses are minimized to just a few dollars, and (b) you will re-learn the life lesson that review stars are not always trustworthy. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: rajp

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Edit: adding stars for them sending out another one. We'll see if it lasts. I thought this would be a really cool product but it broke less than 5 minutes after receiving it. I went to pull out the tape measure and the tip broke off as you can see, making half of the reason I bought this useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kris R.

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value!
customer_reviews.text: Obviously this isn’t a tool for a contractor but for home use it is an incredible value. Firstly it comes with batteries installed. It also comes with a backup set of batteries. It works well of course. They also included a mechanics ruler as a gift. Very happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: steven l brooks

customer_reviews.title: Fragile and inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used the tape measure, it got stuck and wouldn't retract. The laser isn't very accurate, which makes it pretty useless. Should have spent a few extra bucks to buy one that can handle occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: The Fonz

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but not expensive UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: as other reviews says it is not the most accurate but will get the job done UPDATE from 3 to 4 stars: The seller offered to send another one to try. It was shipped quickly. My husband said the precision is better on this device so I took it to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Chy

customer_reviews.title: Worst Product that I have ever bought from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: The inch scale on the base has been smudged in the printing process over the entire 6 inches so you cannot measure anything. The vertical and horizontal laser projections were neither vertical nor horizontal. I used a screwdriver to rotate the lens but they did not maintain the corrected orientation. Finally, and worst, I placed the spirit level against three other levels I own and the vertical bubble was out about a quarter of an inch over the 6-inch length. I was so angry I trashed it. Giving one star was overgenerous.
customer_reviews.author: Great Scot

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well enough for moving to a condo from a home of 47 years and have to rehang a life's worth of pictures. Also you need basic knowledge of a bubble level to make the laser accurate. I am retired from the building trades and am amazed at how many young people are unknowing on using basic home tools. The tape measure is nice to have but more difficult to use than a nice wide one that doesn't fold over. For the money it's pretty darn good, the laser is strong, even in sunlit rooms and had more range than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Hondaddy

product_meta.title: Qooltek Multipurpose Laser Level Laser Line 8 feet Measure Tape Ruler Adjusted Standard and Metric Rulers
product_meta.description:
Qooltek Multi-purpose Laser Level 
Use this Multipurpose Laser Level for hanging pictures, installing shelving,laying flooring, hanging wallpaper and more. 
The tape measure is an 8-foot measure that includes imperial and metric linear measures, with graduations down to 1/32” and 1mm. 


 
Features: 
✔ Laser light has an on/off power switch. 
✔ Class IIIA laser Product, 3.5mW Max Power Output. 
▲Note: Laser Ranging Error,that is given as "+/-2mm at 10m and 25m". 
▲Note: If the laser is the Vertical Level or the Horizontal Level, you shouldn't adjust the Beam.

 
Specifications: 
Product Size: 7.28 (L) x 2.5(W) x 1.1 (H) Inch 
Product Size: 18.5 (L) x 6.2(W) x 2.8 (H) cm 
Packaging Size: 8.27*3.15*1.57 Inch 
Packaging Size: 210*80*40mm 
Color : Black 
Net Weight: 6.49oz 
Net Weight: 184g 
Package weight: 9.2oz 
Package weight: 260g 
Original box: YES 


 
Note: 
▲Laser radiation, avoid direct eye exposure! 
▲A laser device is not a toy and must not be allowed to fall into the hands of children. 
▲Misuse of the device can result in permanent eye damage. 
▲Any correction measures that are aimed at increasing the laser power are forbidden. 
▲The laser device does not contain any customer service components. 
▲Please do not open the housing as doing this would not cover the warranty. 




Note: 
▲Please press the key button when you pull out the measuring tape, it would make the measuring tape better and easier using. 
▲Please loosen the key button to lock the reel when the measuring tape have been drawn out the length you wanted.


Packaging content: 
1 x Screwdriver 
1 x Beam Adjusted Tool 
1 x Level Laser (included:3 x AG 13 Button-Cells) 
Back up battery:3 x AG 13 Button-Cells
feature_bullets: ✔ 3-PRONGED APPROACH - combines a fine-tuned tape measure, a triple-positioned leveling bubble and a NEW laser level to provide maximum results.（Note: Laser Ranging Error,that is given as "+/-2mm at 10m and 25m";If the laser is the Vertical Level or the Horizontal Level, you shouldn't adjust the Beam.)

✔ WORKS FOR INDOOR - designed for any situation where a straight line or accurate measurements are needed, such as measuring locations on a wall, space between hangers, level the nails. Regardless of the situation, it's completely plug & play. Note: Fades in sunlight or outdoor use.
✔ 8-FOOT Measuring Tape - comes loaded with an 8-foot measure that includes imperial and metric linear measures, with graduations down to 1/32" and 1mm.
✔ BACKUP BATTERY - ships with 3 x AG 13 button-cells battery, just to make sure you keep going with maximum convenience.
✔ IDEAL For The Job That Requires A Straight Line Or Accurate Measurement.(Ideal for 🎁Father's Day Gift and building some Thanksgiving decorations)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars6,389 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
